[docs]    def to_config_dict(self, data):
        device = data["logical_drive"]
        config = {}
        config["flash_manufacturer"] = data["manufacturer"]

        for key, value in data.items():
            key = "%s_%s" % (device, key)
            config[key] = value

        return config

        self, smart_data_before, smart_data_after, devices, json_data
    ):
        return



[docs]    def validate_results(self):
        all_smart_errors = None
        optimal_values, delta_values = self.parse_benchmark_and_save_values(
            self.data, self.external_file
        )
        actual = self.get_data(self.blockname)
        all_errors = self.validate_smart_data_with_benchmark(actual, optimal_values)
        if all_errors:
            smart_error = "\nFound Errors in smart data diff:\n"
            for key, value in all_errors.items():
                smart_error += "%s %s\n" % (key, value)
            all_smart_errors = smart_error
        all_errors = self.validate_smart_data_for_delta(actual, delta_values)
        if all_errors:
            smart_error = "\nFound Errors in smart data diff:\n"
            for key, value in all_errors.items():
                smart_error += "%s %s\n" % (key, value)
            if all_smart_errors:
                all_smart_errors += smart_error
            else:
                all_smart_errors = smart_error
        if all_smart_errors:
            raise TestError(all_smart_errors)



[docs]    def evaluate_expression(
        self, actual, expected, opr, msg, lower_val=0, increment_by=0
    ):
        """The function takes expected and actual value and perform comparison
        between them. Logical operators supported are:
        '<' -> less then
        '>' -> greater then
        '>='-> greater then equal to
        '<='-> less then equal to
        '=' -> check equality, similar to ==
        '-' -> inbetween range (lower_val is require)
        '/' -> multiple options (existence of word in a string)
        '~' -> increment the 'expected' by "increment_by" and compare
        """
        opr_match = {
            ">": "gt",
            "<": "lt",
            ">=": "gteq",
            "<=": "lteq",
            "-": "range",
            "/": "isIn",
            "~": "incrementby",
            "=": "isEqual",
        }
        if opr_match[opr] == "range":
            AutovalUtils._validate_lt_gt_eq(
                actual, lower_val, msg, opr_match[">"], log_on_pass=False
            )
            AutovalUtils._validate_lt_gt_eq(
                actual, expected, msg, opr_match["<"], log_on_pass=False
            )
        elif opr_match[opr] == "incrementby":
            expected = expected + increment_by
            AutovalUtils._validate_lt_gt_eq(
                actual, expected, msg, opr_match["<"], log_on_pass=False
            )
        elif opr_match[opr] == "isIn":
            for each in expected:
                AutovalUtils.validate_in(each, actual, msg, log_on_pass=False)
        elif opr_match[opr] == "isEqual":
            AutovalUtils.validate_equal(actual, expected, msg, log_on_pass=False)
        elif opr in opr_match:
            AutovalUtils._validate_lt_gt_eq(
                actual, expected, msg, opr_match[opr], log_on_pass=False
            )
        else:
            raise TestError("No matching operator found to evalute")



[docs]    def get_correct_drive_object(self, drive_serial, drive_list):
        for drv in drive_list:
            serial = drv.data["serial_number"]
            if drive_serial == serial:
                AutovalUtils.log_info("found drive SN with %s" % drive_serial)
                return drv
        raise TestError("Failed to get correct mapping for SN - %s" % (drive_serial))



[docs]    def parse_benchmark_and_save_values(self, smart_data_collection, check_list):
        """
         This function is for saving all smart data of all the attributes
         passed in the checklist file and extract and save them from
         smart_data_collection dictionary that has all storage smart data
         and return back the optimal values to be checked and the save all smart
         data that has to checked after test for no change
         """

        optimal_values = {}
        delta_values = {}
        for line in check_list.splitlines():
            columns = [x.strip() for x in line.split(",")]
            if columns[0] == "check":
                smart_key = columns[1]
                metric = columns[2]
                metric_dict = {}
                metric_dict["Min"] = columns[3]
                metric_dict["Max"] = columns[4]
                if smart_key.isdigit():
                    if not int(smart_key) in optimal_values:
                        optimal_values[int(smart_key)] = {}
                    optimal_values[int(smart_key)][metric] = metric_dict
                else:
                    optimal_values[smart_key] = {}
                    optimal_values[smart_key][metric] = metric_dict
            elif columns[0] == "delta":
                smart_key = columns[1]
                metric = columns[2]
                if len(columns) == 4:
                    tolerance = columns[3]
                else:
                    tolerance = 0
                if smart_key.isdigit():
                    if not int(smart_key) in delta_values:
                        delta_values[int(smart_key)] = {}
                    metric_dict = {}
                    metric_dict["Min"] = int(
                        smart_data_collection[int(smart_key)][metric]
                    )
                    metric_dict["Max"] = int(
                        smart_data_collection[int(smart_key)][metric]
                    ) + int(tolerance)
                    delta_values[int(smart_key)][metric] = metric_dict

                else:
                    if smart_key not in delta_values:
                        delta_values[smart_key] = {}
                    metric_dict = {}
                    metric_dict["Min"] = smart_data_collection[smart_key]
                    metric_dict["Max"] = int(smart_data_collection[smart_key]) + int(
                        tolerance
                    )
                    delta_values[smart_key][metric] = metric_dict
        return (optimal_values, delta_values)



[docs]    def validate_smart_data_with_benchmark(self, smart_data_collection, optimal_values):
        """
        This function is does all the checking of smart validation
        1) check if the drive smart counters are with in the range of the
           optimal values and errors out if there is any discrepancies and give
           all the details of what went wrong
        """

        all_errors = {}
        self.simple_validate(smart_data_collection, optimal_values, all_errors)
        return all_errors



[docs]    def validate_smart_data_for_delta(self, smart_data_collection, optimal_values):
        """
        This Method is to check if the user mentioned smart values dint change
        over testing
        """
        all_errors = {}
        self.simple_validate(smart_data_collection, optimal_values, all_errors)
        return all_errors



[docs]    def simple_validate(self, smart_data, optimal_dict, all_errors):
        """
        This Method is used for validating the smart data of each drive with
        benchmarks to be checked
        """
        for key, value in optimal_dict.items():
            for each in value:
                this_rule = {}
                this_rule["Min"] = value[each]["Min"]
                this_rule["Max"] = value[each]["Max"]
                if isinstance(key, int):
                    all_errors.update(
                        self.check_current_in_range(
                            this_rule,
                            smart_data[int(key)][each],
                            key,
                            each,
                            smart_data["serial_number"],
                        )
                    )
                else:
                    all_errors.update(
                        self.check_current_in_range(
                            this_rule,
                            smart_data[key],
                            key,
                            None,
                            smart_data["serial_number"],
                        )
                    )



[docs]    def check_current_in_range(
        self, current_range, current_value, key, counter=None, drive_serial_num=None
    ):
        """
        This method is used to check if a smart counter is with in the optimal
        range user passed
        """

        errors = {}
        if int(current_value) > int(current_range["Max"]):
            errors.update(
                {
                    "Drive SerialNumber %s, Max value for %s_%s"
                    % (drive_serial_num, key, counter): "Expected: %s. Actual: %s"
                    % (current_range["Max"], current_value)
                }
            )
        if int(current_value) < int(current_range["Min"]):
            errors.update(
                {
                    "Drive SerialNumber %s, Min value for %s_%s"
                    % (drive_serial_num, key, counter): "Expected: %s. Actual: %s"
                    % (current_range["Min"], current_value)
                }
            )
        return errors



[docs]    def update_firmware(self, versions, upgrade, devices, mode=False, fw_slot=""):
        raise NotImplementedError(
            "update_firmware not implemented for this type of storage device"
        )



[docs]    def validate_drive_data(
        self, ext_json, after_json, before_json=None, raise_on_fail=True
    ):
        """This function takes reference json and use it to evalute results
        obtained after the test. It also compare results before and after the
        test """
        actual = None
        expected = None
        before = None
        lower = 0
        errors = ""
        for field in ext_json:
            try:
                msg = "Check value for %s" % field
                actual = after_json[field]
                if before_json is not None:
                    before = before_json[field]
                expected = ext_json[field]
                # Search for mathematical operator in fields. Each operator
                # functionality is listed in evaluate_expression
                out = re.search("==|>|<|/|-|~|>=|<=|=", ext_json[field])
                if out:
                    opr = out.group(0)
                    if opr == "-":
                        lower, higher = expected.split("-")
                        self.evaluate_expression(
                            actual, int(higher), opr, msg, lower_val=int(lower)
                        )
                    elif opr == "~":
                        increment = int(expected.strip(opr))
                        self.evaluate_expression(
                            actual, before, opr, msg, increment_by=increment
                        )
                    elif opr == "/":
                        expected = expected.split("/")
                        self.evaluate_expression(expected, actual, opr, msg)
                    elif opr == "==":
                        self.evaluate_expression(actual, before, "=", msg)
                    else:
                        expected = expected.strip(opr)
                        if expected.isdigit():
                            expected = int(expected)
                        if (
                            not isinstance(actual, int) or isinstance(actual, float)
                            and actual.isdigit()
                        ):
                            actual = int(actual)
                        self.evaluate_expression(actual, expected, opr, msg)
                else:
                    raise TestError(
                        "No matching operator found in %s." % ext_json[field]
                    )
            except Exception as ex:
                errors += str(ex)
        if raise_on_fail and errors:
            raise TestError(errors)
        else:
            return errors



[docs]    def get_usage_type(self, dram_size_max=0):
        return "drive"



[docs]    def get_drive_capacity_details(self, blockname):
        """Return dictionary of avialable space, total physical disk space,
           total sectors"""
        drive_details = {}
        total = DiskUtils.get_drive_capacity(self.blockname)
        drive_details["size"] = {"TB": total["TB"], "GB": total["GB"]}
        drive_details.update(DiskUtils.get_drive_capacity(blockname, fdisk=True))
        return drive_details
